flawed_nl_solution:
At the meeting, 200-100=<<200-100=100>>100 people decided to have a snack.
20 new people came in to snack and the area had 100+20=<<100+20=120>>120 of them eating.
120/2=<<120/2=60>>60 people got full and left.
10 more new people came to join in the snacking so 60+10=<<10+60=72>>72 people were eating.
After 30 people left, 72-30=<<72-30=42>>42 people who were eating remained.
In the end, only 42/2=<<42/2=21>>21 kept eating.
#### 21

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 70, not 72. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
